title: Authors and Citation
text: Drost HG, Gabel , Jiu J, Quint M, Grosse .  myTAI: evolutionary transcriptomics R.  Bioinformatics (2018). doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btx835
code: @Article{,   title = {myTAI: evolutionary transcriptomics with R},   author = {Drost HG and Gabel A and Jiu J and Quint M and Grosse I},   journal = {Bioinformatics},   year = {2018},   volume = {34},   number = {9},   pages = {1589-1590}, }

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: past years, variety studies aimed uncover molecular basis morphological innovation variation evolutionary developmental perspective. studies often rely transcriptomic data establish molecular patterns driving complex biological processes underlying phenotypic plasticity. Although transcriptome information useful start study molecular mechanisms underlying biological process interest (molecular phenotype), rarely capture expression patterns emerged first place extent possibly constrained, thereby neglecting evolutionary history developmental constraints genes contributing overall pool expressed transcripts. overcome limitation, myTAI package introduces procedures summarized term evolutionary transcriptomics integrate gene age information classical gene expression analysis. Gene age inference can performed various existing software, recommend using GenEra orthomap, since address published shortcomings gene age inference (see detailed discussion ). addition, users can easily retrieve previously precomputed gene age information via data package phylomapr. Evolutionary transcriptomics studies can serve first approach screen silico potential existence evolutionary developmental constraints within biological process interest. achieved quantifying transcriptome conservation patterns underlying gene sets biological processes. exploratory analysis functions implemented myTAI provide users standardized, automated statistically sound framework detect analyze patterns evolutionary constraints transcriptome dataset interest.

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: Please cite following paper using myTAI research. allow continue working software tool motivate extend functionality usability next years. Many thanks advance! Drost et al. myTAI: evolutionary transcriptomics R. Bioinformatics 2018, 34 (9), 1589-1590. doi:10.1093

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: myTAI using OpenMP run cpp code parallel, thus might need install additional software. Mac: Linux: 1. Check OpenMP-enabled compiler: Open terminal run command gcc --version g++ --version check GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) installed. OpenMP support typically included GCC. Install libomp library: Open terminal run command appropriate package manager: Ubuntu Debian-based systems: sudo apt-get install libomp-dev sudo apt install libomp-dev Fedora CentOS systems: sudo dnf install libomp-devel Arch Linux: sudo pacman -S libomp Windows: Windows, common OpenMP implementation provided Microsoft Visual C++ (MSVC) compiler, includes OpenMP support default. , using MSVC C++ compiler, OpenMP support without additional installations.
code: brew install llvm libomp cd /usr/local/lib ln -s /usr/local/opt/libomp/lib/libomp.dylib ./libomp.dylib If you don't have GCC installed, you can install it using your distribution's package manager. For example, on Ubuntu, you can use sudo apt-get install build-essential to install GCC.

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: Users can install myTAI CRAN:
code: # install myTAI 0.9.3 from CRAN install.packages("myTAI", dependencies = TRUE)  # install the developer version containing the newest features devtools::install_github("drostlab/myTAI")

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: Using myTAI, existing newly generated transcriptome dataset can combined evolutionary information (find details ) retrieve novel insights evolutionary conservation transcriptome hand. purpose performing large scale evolutionary transcriptomics studies, myTAI package implements quantification, statistical assessment, analytics functionality allow researchers study evolution biological processes determining stages periods evolutionary conservation variability transcriptome data. hope myTAI become community standard tool perform evolutionary transcriptomics studies happy add required functionality upon request.

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: Today, phenomena morphological mutations, diseases developmental processes primarily investigated molecular level using transcriptomics approaches. Transcriptomes denote total number quantifiable transcripts present specific stage biological process. disease developmental (defect) studies, transcriptomes usually measured several time points. treatment studies aiming quantify differences transcriptome due biotic stimuli, abiotic stimuli, diseases usually treatment / disease versus non-treatment / non-disease transcriptomes compared. either case, comparing changes transcriptomes time treatments allows us identify genes gene regulatory mechanisms might involved governing biological process investigation. Although classic transcriptomics studies based established methodology, little known evolution conservation mechanisms underlying transcriptomes. Understanding evolutionary mechanism change transcriptomes time, however, might give us new perspective diseases emerge first place morphological changes triggered changes developmental transcriptomes. Evolutionary transcriptomics aims capture quantify evolutionary conservation genes contribute transcriptome specific stage biological process interest. resulting temporal conservation pattern enables detect stages development biological processes evolutionarily conserved (Drost et al., 2018). quantification highest level achieved transcriptome indices (e.g. Transcriptome Age Index Transcriptome Divergence Index) aim quantify average evolutionary age Barrera-Redondo et al., 2022 sequence conservation Drost et al., 2015 genes contribute transcriptome particular stage. general, evolutionary transcriptomics can used method quantify evolutionary conservation transcriptomes particular developmental stages investigate transcriptomes underlying biological processes constrained channeled due events evolutionary history (Dollo’s law) (Drost et al., 2017). Please note, since myTAI relies gene age inference extensive debate best approaches gene age inference last years, please follow updated discussion gene age inference literature. GenEra, addressed previously raised issues encourage users run GenEra aiming infer gene ages myTAI analyses.

Introduction myTAI Package Intermediate Concepts Phylotranscriptomics Advanced Topics Phylotranscriptomics Perform Age Enrichment Analyses Gene Expression Analysis myTAI Taxonomic Information Retrieval Discussing Genomic Phylostratigraphy

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
code: library(myTAI) # example dataset covering 7 stages of A thaliana embryo development data("PhyloExpressionSetExample") # transform absolute expression levels to log2 expression levels ExprExample <- tf(PhyloExpressionSetExample, log2)

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
code: # visualize global Transcriptome Age Index pattern PlotSignature(ExprExample)

what: Quantify expression level distributions for each gene age category
title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
code: # plot expression level distributions for each age (=PS) category  # and each developmental stage  PlotCategoryExpr(ExprExample, "PS")

what: Quantify mean expression of individual gene age categories
title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
code: # plot mean expression of each age category seperated by old (PS1-3) # versus young (PS4-12) genes PlotMeans(ExprExample, Groups = list(1:3, 4:12))

what: Quantify relative mean expression of each age category seperated by old versus young genes
title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
code: # plot relative mean expression of each age category seperated by old (PS1-3) # versus young (PS4-12) genes PlotRE(ExprExample, Groups = list(1:3, 4:12)) # plot the significant differences between gene expression distributions  # of old (=group1) versus young (=group2) genes PlotGroupDiffs(ExpressionSet = ExprExample,                Groups        = list(group_1 = 1:3, group_2 = 4:12),                legendName    = "PS",                plot.type     = "boxplot")

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: Users can also read tutorials within (RStudio) : myTAI framework users can find:
code: # source the myTAI package library(myTAI)  # look for all tutorials (vignettes) available in the myTAI package # this will open your web browser browseVignettes("myTAI")  # or as single tutorials  # open tutorial: Introduction to Phylotranscriptomics and myTAI  vignette("Introduction", package = "myTAI")  # open tutorial: Intermediate Concepts of Phylotranscriptomics  vignette("Intermediate", package = "myTAI")  # open tutorial: Advanced Concepts of Phylotranscriptomics  vignette("Advanced", package = "myTAI")  # open tutorial: Age Enrichment Analyses  vignette("Enrichment", package = "myTAI")   # open tutorial: Gene Expression Analysis with myTAI  vignette("Expression", package = "myTAI")    # open tutorial: Taxonomic Information Retrieval with myTAI  vignette("Taxonomy", package = "myTAI")    # open tutorial: Discussing Genomic Phylostratigraphy  vignette("Phylostratigraphy", package = "myTAI")

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: TAI() : Function compute Transcriptome Age Index (TAI) TDI() : Function compute Transcriptome Divergence Index (TDI) TPI() : Function compute Transcriptome Polymorphism Index (TPI) REMatrix() : Function compute relative expression profiles phylostrata divergence-strata RE() : Function transform mean expression levels relative expression levels pTAI() : Compute Phylostratum Contribution global TAI pTDI() : Compute Divergence Stratum Contribution global TDI pMatrix() : Compute Partial TAI TDI Values pStrata() : Compute Partial Strata Values

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: PlotSignature() : Main visualization function plot evolutionary signatures across transcriptomes PlotPattern() : Base graphics function plot evolutionary signatures across transcriptomes PlotContribution() : Plot Cumulative Transcriptome Index PlotCorrelation() : Function plot correlation phylostratum values divergence-stratum values PlotRE() : Function plot relative expression profiles PlotBarRE() : Function plot mean relative expression levels phylostratum divergence-stratum classes barplot PlotMeans() : Function plot mean expression profiles age categories PlotMedians() : Function plot median expression profiles age categories PlotVars() : Function plot expression variance profiles age categories PlotDistribution() : Function plot frequency distribution genes within corresponding age categories PlotCategoryExpr() : Plot Expression Levels Age Divergence Category Barplot Violinplot PlotEnrichment() : Plot Phylostratum Divergence Stratum Enrichment given Gene Set PlotGeneSet() : Plot Expression Profiles Gene Set PlotGroupDiffs() : Plot significant differences gene expression distributions PS DS groups PlotSelectedAgeDistr() : Plot PS DS distribution selected set genes

what: A Statistical Framework and Test Statistics:
title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: FlatLineTest() : Function perform Flat Line Test quantifies statistical significance observed phylotranscriptomics pattern (significant deviation frat line = evolutionary signal) ReductiveHourglassTest() : Function perform Reductive Hourglass Test statistically evaluates existence phylotranscriptomic hourglass pattern (hourglass model) EarlyConservationTest() : Function perform Reductive Early Conservation Test statistically evaluates existence monotonically increasing phylotranscriptomic pattern (early conservation model) LateConservationTest() : Function perform Reductive Late Conservation Test statistically evaluates existence monotonically decreasing phylotranscriptomic pattern (early divergence model) ReverseHourglassTest(): Function perform Reverse Hourglass Test statistically evaluates existence reverse hourglass pattern (low-high-low) PairwiseTest(): Function perform Pairwise Difference Test statistically evaluates difference TAI (TDI) two constrasts, e.g. male vs female samples. EnrichmentTest() : Phylostratum Divergence Stratum Enrichment given Gene Set based Fisher’s Test bootMatrix() : Compute Permutation Matrix Test Statistics functions also include visual analytics tools quantify goodness test statistics.

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: DiffGenes() : Implements Popular Methods Differential Gene Expression Analysis CollapseReplicates() : Combine Replicates ExpressionSet CombinatorialSignificance() : Compute Statistical Significance Replicate Combination Expressed() : Filter Expression Levels Gene Expression Matrices (define expressed genes) SelectGeneSet() : Select Subset Genes ExpressionSet PlotReplicateQuality() : Plot Quality Biological Replicates GroupDiffs() : Quantify significant differences gene expression distributions PS DS groups

title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: taxonomy() : Retrieve Taxonomic Information Organism Interest

what: Minor Functions for Better Usibility and Additional Analyses
title: Evolutionary Transcriptomics
text: MatchMap() : Match Phylostratigraphic Map Divergence Map ExpressionMatrix tf() : Transform Gene Expression Levels tfPS() : Transform Phylostratum Levels tfStability() : Perform Permutation Tests Different Transformations age.apply() : Age Category Specific apply Function ecScore() : Compute Hourglass Score EarlyConservationTest lcScore() : Compute Hourglass Score LateConservationTest pairScore() : Compute PairwiseTest Score PairwiseTest geom.mean() : Geometric Mean harm.mean() : Harmonic Mean omitMatrix() : Compute TAI TDI Profiles Omitting Given Gene rhScore() : Compute Hourglass Score Reductive Hourglass Test reversehourglassScore(): Compute Reverse Hourglass Score Reverse Hourglass Test

title: Transform Phylostratum Values — tfPS
text: function performs transformation phylostratum values.

title: Transform Phylostratum Values — tfPS
text: ExpressionSet standard PhyloExpressionSet object. transform character vector valid function transforms PS values. Possible values can : transform = "qr" ("quantilerank") : quantile rank transformation analogous Julia function StatsBase.quantilerank using method = :tied.

title: Transform Phylostratum Values — tfPS
text: standard PhloExpressionSet object storing transformed Phylostratum levels.

title: Transform Phylostratum Values — tfPS
text: function transforms phylostratum assignment. return value function PhyloExpressionSet object transformed phylostratum tfPhylostratum first column, satisfying .ExpressionSet. Note input transform must available function, currently limited "qr" ("quantilerank").

title: Transform Phylostratum Values — tfPS
text: Jaruwatana Sodai Lotharukpong Lukas Maischak

title: myTAI 1.0.2.9000
text: New function tfPS() : Perform transformation phylostratum values, analogous PS() transforms expression levels. Currently, tfPS() supports quantile rank transformation. New function PairwiseTest() : Statistically evaluate pairwise difference phylotranscriptomic pattern two contrasts based   computations. New function pairScore() : Compute pairwise difference TAI (TDI) score.

title: myTAI 1.0.2.9000
text: Removed taxonomy() references due deprecation taxize(). needed CRAN submission.

title: myTAI 1.0.1.9000
text: New function PlotSignatureTransformed() : Plot evolutionary signatures across transcriptomes RNA-seq transformations New function tfStability(): Perform Permutation Tests Different Transformations (test robustness p-values given test (e.g. FlatLineTest(), ReductiveHourglassTest(), ReverseHourglassTest(), EarlyConservationTest() LateConservationTest()) expression data transformations) New function LateConservationTest() : Perform Reductive Late Conservation Test (test high-mid-low (high-high-low) TAI TDI pattern) New function lcScore() : Compute Hourglass Score LateConservationTest internal rcpp functions now using Eigen automatically enable parallelization

title: myTAI 1.0.1.9000
text: PlotSignature() updated able perform TestStatistic = "LateConservationTest". PlotSignature() now prints p-value subtitle rather via ggplot2::annotate(). tf() now pseudocount parameter, useful performing logarithmic transformations genes 0 counts. tf() now supports vst rlog transformations DESeq2. tf() now intergerise parameter, needed applying vst rlog transformations. tf() updated documentation performing rank transformation, assigns ranks gene expression values within stage, based relative positions compared values. Improvements existing test functions (ecScore(), rhScore() reversehourglassScore()) give message phylotranscriptomic pattern unlikely follow test statistics. FlatLineTest() - newly returns ks test statistics fitting gamma FlatLineTest() - improved fitting FlatLineTest() - cpp functions newly parallelized progress bar implemented computation permutations

title: myTAI 1.0.1.9000
text: changes remove errors warnings devtools::test() devtools::check(), building package, accumulated previous updates.

title: myTAI 1.0.0
text: New function TEI(): Compute Transcriptome Evolutionary Index New function pMatrixTEI: Compute Partial Transcriptome Evolutionary Index (TEI) Values New function pStrataTEI: Compute Partial Transcriptome Evolutionary Index (TEI) Strata Values New function bootTEI: Compute Permutation Matrix Transcriptome Evolutionary Index (TEI) new internal rcpp functions support parallel C++ computations TEI(), pMatrixTEI(), pStrataTEI(), bootTEI()

title: myTAI 1.0.0
text: CollapseReplicates() now returns tibble objects PlotCategoryExpr() received new argument y.ticks

title: myTAI 1.0.0
text: CollapseFromTo() now exception replicate number 1 passed function -> previously cause error occur

title: myTAI 0.9.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-24 removing depreciated std::random_shuffle() function sample plylostratum divergence stratum columns replacing std::shuffle(). See full discussion . removing depreciated function calls dplyr::funs() tibble::.tibble() updated unit tests

title: myTAI 0.9.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-01-10 changing maintainer email-address

title: myTAI 0.9.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-03-10 fixing unit test uses set.seed(123) causes error new R version 3.6.0 due switch non-uniform "Rounding" sampler "Rejection" sampler new R version; corresponding unit test test-PlotEnrichment.R adjusted accordingly. CRAN statement: Note ensures using (old) non-uniform “Rounding” sampler 3.x versions R, add R version dependency. Note also new “Rejection” sampler R use 3.6.0 onwards default definitely preferable old one, really used temporary measure reproduction previous behavior (run time tests relying ).

title: myTAI 0.9.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-02-06

title: myTAI 0.9.0
text: new function ReverseHourglassTest() perform Reverse Hourglass Test. Reverse Hourglass Test aims statistically evaluate existence reverse hourglass pattern based TAI TDI computations. corresponding p-value quantifies probability given TAI TDI pattern (phylotranscriptomics pattern) follow hourglass like shape. p-value < 0.05 indicates corresponding phylotranscriptomics pattern rather follow reverse hourglass (low-high-low) shape. new function reversehourglassScore() computing Reverse Hourglass Score Reverse Hourglass Test

title: myTAI 0.9.0
text: function PlotSignature() receives new TestStatistic (TestStatistic = "ReverseHourglassTest") perform revserse hourglass test (= testing significance low-high-low pattern)

title: myTAI 0.6.0
text: .ExpressionSet() now prints detailed error messages ExpressionSet format violated adapt PlotContribution() new version dplyr summarise_each() deprecated. Error message occurring new dplyr release : Failure: PlotContribution() works properly DivergenceExpressionSet input… (@test-PlotContribution.R#16) PlotContribution(DivergenceExpressionSetExample, legendName = “DS”) produced messages. summarise_each() deprecated. Use summarise_all(), summarise_at() summarise_if() instead. map funs variables, use summarise_all() summarise_each() deprecated. Use summarise_all(), summarise_at() summarise_if() instead. map funs variables, use summarise_all() now fixed.

title: myTAI 0.5.0

title: myTAI 0.5.0

PlotRE() now based ggplot2 lost base graphics arguments.

title: myTAI 0.2.0
text: adding new vignette Taxonomy providing spep step instructions retrieving taxonomic information organism interest adding new vignette Expression Analysis providing use cases perform gene expression data analysis myTAI adding new vignette Enrichment providing step--step instructions perform PS DS enrichment analyses PlotEnrichment() adding examples pStrata(), pMatrix(), pTAI(), pTDI(), PlotContribution() Introduction Vignette

title: myTAI 0.2.0
text: new function taxonomy() allows users retrieve taxonomic information organism interest; function taken biomartr package removed biomartr afterwards. Please notice, myTAI version 0.1.0 Introduction vignette referenced taxonomy() function biomartr. longer case (since myTAI version 0.2.0), now taxonomy() implemented myTAI. new taxonomy() function based powerful R package taxize. new function SelectGeneSet() allows users fastly select subset genes ExpressionSet new function DiffGenes() allows users perform differential gene expression analysis ExpressionSet objects new function EnrichmentTest() allows users perform Fisher’s exact test based enrichment analysis underrepresented Phylostrata Divergence Strata within given gene set without plot result new function PlotGeneSet() allows users visualize expression profiles given gene set new function PlotEnrichment() allows users visualize Phylostratum Divergence Stratum enrichment given Gene Set well computing Fisher’s exact test quantify statistical significance enrichment new function PlotContribution() allows users visualize Phylostratum Divergence Stratum contribution global TAI/TDI pattern new function pTAI() allows users compute phylostratum contribution global TAI pattern new function pTDI() allows users compute divergence stratum contribution global TDI pattern

title: myTAI 0.2.0
text: FilterRNASeqCT() renamed Expressed() allowing users apply filter function RNA-Seq data well microarray data PlotRE() PlotMeans() now based colors RColorBrewer package (default) PlotRE() PlotMeans() now new argument colors allowing unsers choose custom colors visualized relative mean expression profiles geom.mean() harm.mean() now external functions accessible myTAI user

title: myTAI 0.1.0
text: function MatchMap() now receives new argument remove.duplicates allowing users delete duplicate gene ids (might stored input PhyoMap DivergenceMap) process matching Map ExpressionSet FlatLineTest(), ReductiveHourglassTest(), EarlyConservationTest(), PlotPattern() implement new argument custom.perm.matrix allowing users pass (custom) permutation matrix corresponding function. subsequent test statistics p-value/std.dev computations based custom permutation matrix EarlyConservationTest() ReductiveHourglassTest() now new parameter gof.warning allowing users choose whether non significant goodness fit results printed warning now specifying TestStatistic = NULL PlotPattern() TAI/TDI profile drawn (without performing test statistics); equavalent performing: plot(TAI(PhyloExpressionSetExample) function combinatorialSignificance() now named CombinatorialSignificance() changing title description myTAI package minor changes vignettes within documentation functions

title: myTAI 0.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2014-11-01 Introducing myTAI 0.0.1: framework perform phylotranscriptomics analyses Evolutionary Developmental Biology research.
